Macros

#define BSP_VID_SENSOR_DEV_PER_PORT_MAX   (2U)
 Max devices that can be associated with a single VIP port.
 
#define BSP_VID_SENSOR_DEFAULT   ((UInt32) 0xFFFFFFFFU)
 Value to use, when it is needed to apply device specific default setting value.
 
#define BSP_VID_SENSOR_NO_CHANGE   ((UInt32) 0xFFFFFFFEU)
 Value to use, when it is needed to NOT change a device specific setting value.
 
#define BSP_VID_SENSOR_GPIO_NONE   ((UInt32) 0xFFFFFFFFU)
 Value to use, when there no GPIO is used for device reset.
 
#define BSP_VID_SENSOR_DLY_REG   (0xABCD)
 Video sensor dummy register used for introducing delay in sensor.
 
#define BSP_VID_SENSOR_DLY_REG_MASK   (0xFF00)
 Video sensor dummy register mask.

Detailed Description

This modules define API to capture sensor data using external sensors like OV10635, OV10630, MT9M024, OV10633, AR0132. Typically the external Camera sensor interface to the host via one of the VIP ports. I2C is used to send control commands to the camera Sensor.

User application controls and configures the camera sensor

The following video sensor's are currently supported

  • OV10630
  • OV10635
  • AR0132
  • OV2659

The API interface used in the FVID2 interface (See also FVID2 API)

The following FVID2 APIs are supported by video decoder device drivers,

  • Creating the driver - Fvid2_create()
    Parameter Value
    drvId FVID2_VID_SENSOR_OV1063X_DRV
    FVID2_VID_SENSOR_LI_OV1063X_DRV
    FVID2_VID_SENSOR_MULDES_OV1063X_DRV
    FVID2_VID_SENSOR_APT_AR0132_DRV
    FVID2_VID_SENSOR_OV2659_DRV
    instanceId Set to 0
    createArgs Bsp_VidSensorCreateParams *
    createStatusArgs Bsp_VidSensorCreateStatus *
    cbParams NOT USED, Set to NULL.
    Fvid2_Handle returned by Fvid2_create() is used in subsequent FVID2 APIs
  • Deleting the driver - Fvid2_delete()
    Parameter Value
    deleteArgs NOT USED, set to NULL
  • Starting the driver - Fvid2_start()
    Parameter Value
    cmdArgs NOT USED, set to NULL
  • Stopping the driver - Fvid2_stop()
    Parameter Value
    cmdArgs NOT USED, set to NULL
  • Controlling the driver - Fvid2_control()
    All supported camera sensor implement these IOCTLs.

Typicall API calling sequence for video decoder in context of video capture application would be like below

  • Fvid2_create() - create the sensor driver instance and take the sensor to standby
  • IOCTL_BSP_VID_SENSOR_GET_CHIP_ID - check if device is active
  • IOCTL_BSP_VID_SENSOR_GET_FEATURES - To get the sensor information and support
  • IOCTL_BSP_VID_SENSOR_SET_CONFIG - setup the device for a particular mode
  • Fvid2_start() - Start sensor
  • Fvid2_stop() - Take sensor to standby
  • Fvid2_delete() - delete sensor driver device
  • Delete the capture driver
